page.title: 06ECOLOGY
page.content: Interview with resident: Occupies his ancient cottage, 'Merry Meeting' and owns two other cottages, both summer lets, upon his two acres and is wholly self-sufficient in home-grown produce and maintenance work. Since abandoning secondary P.E. teaching, devotes himself to wild-life conservation, especially nurturing endangered owls and falcons to return to the wild. As local "contact" he is frequently contacted on conservation issues by diverse informants including fishermen, poachers and gamekeepers. A keen fisherman, lobster-catcher and falconer, he believes fiercely in scrupulous, sportsmanlike methods which protect the ecology, and is an active campaigner to clean up the polluted, life-destroying waters of the Torridge.
